WMRSD System of Care - December Newsletter -Archived (1)
COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

br.span: NOTICE: Governor Sununu announced that remote learning will be extended for the remainder of the school year and that students and staff will not be returning to the school buildings.

a.span: COVID Information and Remote Learning Resources

p.span: The White Mountains Regional School District uses our collective resources to educate responsible and ethical citizens who are academically, socially, and physically prepared to meet the needs of our community in an ever-changing world.

Our School District is located in the beautiful White Mountains in northern New Hampshire. Our district includes three schools and one administrative office serving the communities of Carroll, Dalton, Jefferson, Lancaster, and Whitefield.

div.div: A Letter from Jessica Loiacono re: 2/13/2020 Working Session

div.p: The White Mountains Regional School District (SAU #36) is a recent recipient of the New Hampshire System of Care (SoC) FAST Forward 2020 Grant. This is a four year grant awarded from the federal Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) which will support the expansion and sustainability of a state level system of care for children, youth and their families. This grant is administered through the New Hampshire Department of Education by the Office of Student Wellness. This an exciting time for the White Mountains Regional School District community, paving the way towards behavioral health and wellness for all students in the district.

a.title: WMRSD System of Care Grant Website

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

span.br: *If you reside in Whitefield, Dalton, or Carroll, your designated school is Whitefield Elementary School

p.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

em.span: *If you reside in Lancaster or Jefferson, your designated school is Lancaster Elementary School.
